newsitem.title: USA: Utah avalanche kills three skiers.
newsitem.headline: Utah avalanche kills three skiers.

text.p: Rescuers have found the bodies of three skiers in their sleeping bags in their tent buried under snow from a weekend avalanche in Utah, officials said Wednesday.
The three experienced skiers were found late Monday night, said Bob DeGasser of the Cache County Sheriff's office.
When they did not return on Monday as planned, searchers from the sheriff's office and the Backcountry Emergency Response Team were sent out.

DeGasser said officials believed a slab of snow 4 to 6 feet deep and 300 feet wide had been dislodged and slid more than 1,000 feet down a south-facing slope, snapping trees and burying the men, apparently as they slept.
